Let BB' = d metre. Both Statement I and Statement II are true but Statement II is not the correct explanation of Statement I
Statement I is true but Statement II is false
Statement I is false but Statement II is true

content.question_text: A man, standing at a point X on the bank XY of a river that cannot be crossed, observes a tower to be N α° E on the opposite parallel bank. He then walks 200 m along the bank to the point Y towards East, and finds the tower to be N β° W. From these observations, the breadth of the river will be (Given that tan a° = 2 and tan β° = 0.5)[2017 CDS-II]

If the radius of the base of the cylinder is 50 m, the height of the cylinder is 10 m and the total height of the tent is 15 m, then what is the capacity of the tent in cubic metres ?[2017 CDS-II]

If A is perpendicular to C and B is perpendicular to C; then A and B are parallel.3.
